abstract.t: It is common practice on the Internet to permit anonymous access tovarious services. Traditionally, this has been done with a plain textpassword mechanism using 'anonymous' as the user name and optionaltrace information, such as an email address, as the password. Asplaintext login commands are not permitted in new IETF protocols, anew way to provide anonymous login is needed within the context of theSimple Authentication and Security Layer (SASL) framework.
